title: How to Make Sirloin Marinara

steps.headline: Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onions and sauté until tender.
Add steak strips.
steps.description:

steps.headline: Add tomato sauce, garlic and red wine.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the steak is cooked through.

text:
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and sauté until tender. Add steak strips. Turn the strips so that all sides get browned. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Make-Sirloin-Marinara-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Sirloin-Marinara-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Make-Sirloin-Marinara-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/aid360780-v4-728px-Make-Sirloin-Marinara-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Add tomato sauce, garlic and red wine. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the steak is cooked through. Finished.
